thread.title: SportsDay's Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week (9/21): QB Baker Mayfield's record-setting day prevents upset
thread.title_full: SportsDay's Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week (9/21): QB Baker Mayfield's record-setting day prevents upset | Dallas Morning News

author: Shehan Jeyarajah
title: SportsDay's Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week (9/21): QB Baker Mayfield's record-setting day prevents upset
text:
Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week
Baker Mayfield, Oklahoma QB
Height: 6-foot-2
Weight: 214 pounds
Class: Junior
Season stats: 74-for-110 passing for 1,062 yards, 10 TDs, 2 INTs; 33 rushes for 139 yards, 4 TDs
Why he deserves it: Many people counted Baker Mayfield out after he lost the starting job at Texas Tech and opted to transfer to Oklahoma. But the Lake Travis product wrested the job from Trevor Knight in the offseason and has looked impressive to start. The former walk-on broke an Oklahoma school record with 572 yards of total offense. Perhaps more impressive than his total production was his efficiency. Mayfield completed 32 of 38 passes for 487 yards and four touchdowns, while adding touchdown runs of 39 and 8 yards to set the tone early. Oklahoma's defense struggled against Phil Montgomery and the Tulsa Golden Hurricane, but Mayfield ensured the Sooners would pick up a victory and move up once again in the Associated Press poll.
Honorable mention: QB Jerrod Heard, Texas (20-for-31 for 364 yards; 24 rushes for 163 yards, 3 TDs in 45-44 loss to Cal); WR Reginald Davis, Texas Tech (5 catches for 115 yards, 2 TDs in 35-24 win over Arkansas); QB Trevone Boykin, TCU (21-for-30 for 454 yards, 5 TDs; 11 rushes for 50 yards, TD in 45-37 win over SMU); WR Josh Doctson, TCU (5 catches for 171 yards, 2 TDs in 56-37 win over SMU); RB Chris Carson, Oklahoma State (17 carries for 104 yards, 2 TDs in 69-14 win over UTSA)
